metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4666 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.1 isaffected. Safari before 10.0.1 is affected. tvOS before 10.0.1 is affected.The issue involves the "WebKit" component. It allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption andapplication crash) via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
webkit2gtk package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
